mixed-citation.article-title: The Changhsingian (Late Permian) ammonoids from Baghuk Mountain (Central Iran)

tp:taxon-treatment.tp:nomenclature:
Genus
Arasella Korn
in
Ghaderi et al. , 2014

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Sinoceltites ? minutus
Zakharov in
Kotlyar et al. , 1983
, by original designation

Sinoceltites ? minutus
Zakharov in
Kotlyar et al. , 1983
;
Arasella falcata Korn & Hairapetian
sp. nov.

The genus
Arasella
is somewhat problematic because of its very simple suture line; an unambiguous attribution to a distinct family is therefore difficult. The shape of the external lobe rather speaks for placing it in the family Xenodiscidae rather than the Dzhulfitidae . The shape of the conch and the sculpture are similar to the early Changhsingian
Shevyrevites
, but this genus has multidentate adventive and lateral lobes.
